byline.contributor: Isabel Kershner reported from Jerusalem, and Tim Arango from Istanbul. Jodi Rudoren contributed reporting from Jerusalem, and Julie Hirschfeld Davis from Washington.
byline.original: By ISABEL KERSHNER and TIM ARANGO

abstract: Israel and Tukey close in on restoration of diplomatic ties, which were severed after bloody 2010 confrontation between Israeli soldiers and Turkish activists aboard ship bringing supplies to Gaza; deal, which would also promote economic cooperation, revives alliance which also benefits United States by increasing Middle East stability.
lead_paragraph: Turkey will drop charges against Israeli officers in the deaths of Turkish activists aboard a ship in 2010, and Israel will establish a fund for the victims’ families.

headline.main: Israel and Turkey Agree to Restore Diplomatic Ties
headline.print_headline: Israel and Turkey Near Deal to Restore Relations

snippet: Turkey will drop charges against Israeli officers in the deaths of Turkish activists aboard a ship in 2010, and Israel will establish a fund for the victims’ families.
